Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Fresenius Medical Care entered into a $120,447.23 settlement agreement to resolve allegations that Fresenius employed an individual who was excluded from participating in any Federal health care programs.

Company: Fresenius Medical Care (fka National Medical Care)
Description: Fresenius Medical Care, formerly known as National Medical Care,  agreed to pay a $101 million criminal fine and a $385 million civil settlement to resolve allegations that the company submitted false claims for laboratory tests and conspired to pay illegal kickbacks.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/dag/speeches/2000/nmichaelhealthremarks.htm

Description: A federal court found that Renal Care Group, Renal Care Group Supply Company and Fresenius Medical Care Holdings, Inc.  recklessly disregarded federal law when billing the Medicare program for home dialysis supplies and equipment from 1999 to 2005.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/usao/tnm/pressReleases/2011/5-26-11.html

Description: overtime violation
Private Litigation Case Title: Juan Moreyra v. Fresenius Medical Case Holdings Inc et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/393561/fresenius-pays-nearly-1m-to-end-dialysis-clinic-ot-suit

Company: Fresenius Medical Care AG & Co. KGaA
Description: Fresenius Medical Care AG & Co. KGaA, a German-based provider of medical products and services, agreed to pay approximately $84 million to resolve criminal charges of violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act in connection with corrupt schemes to obtain business in multiple foreign countries.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/fresenius-medical-care-agrees-pay-231-million-criminal-penalties-and-disgorgement-resolve

Description: health information data breach
Agency: Health & Human Services Department Office for Civil Rights
Info Source: https://www.hhs.gov/about/news/2018/02/01/five-breaches-add-millions-settlement-costs-entity-failed-heed-hipaa-s-risk-analysis-and-risk.html

Company: Fresenius Medical Care AG & Co KGaA
Description: Fresenius Medical Care agreed to pay $147 million to resolve SEC allegations of violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act across multiple countries for nearly a decade.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/news/press-release/2019-48

Description: Fresenius Medical Care agreed to pay nearly $70,000 to settle charges that its subsidiaries conspired  submit false, fraudulent, and misleading claims for nutritional therapy for dialysis patients, inflating the number of administration kits used to provide the therapy, and paying kickbacks to dialysis units.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20030306183551fw_/http://www.ag.state.ar.us/prrecent69.htm

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Fresenius agreed to pay more than $5 million in settlement of allegations it violated Medicaid guidelines by failing to warn doctors and dialysis clinics that its dialysis product GrunuFlo could cause dangerously increased bicarbonate levels.
Info Source: https://kentucky.gov/Pages/Activity-stream.aspx?n=AttorneyGeneral&prId=719

Description: Fresenius Medical Care agreed to pay $7.6 million to settle multistate litigation alleging that it paid illegal kickbacks to healthcare providers and thus caused false claims to be submitted to state Medicaid programs. This was part of a larger $486 million civil and criminal settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-fresenius-medical-care-fka-national-medi
Info Source: Fresenius Medical Care North America Agrees to Pay $486 Million to Resolve Health Care Fraud Investigation, Reports U.S. Attorney, PR Newswire, January 19, 2000 (via Nexis).

Description: Fresenius agreed to pay $5.2 million to resolve allegations that the company tested dialysis patients for Hepatitis B surface antigen more frequently than medically necessary and then billed Medicare for the unnecessary tests.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/usao-ma/pr/fresenius-agrees-pay-52-million-resolve-allegations-it-overbilled-medicare-hepatitis-b

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Indian drug manufacturer Fresenius Kabi Oncology Limited (FKOL) agreed to plead guilty to concealing and destroying records prior to a 2013 U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) inspection and pay $50 million in fines and forfeiture.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/indian-cancer-drug-manufacturer-agrees-plead-guilty-and-pay-50-million-concealing-and

Primary Offense: drug or medical equipment safety violation
Description: Fresenius agreed to pay $250 million to settle multi-district litigation alleging that two dialysis drugs caused dangerous side effects: https://www.freseniusmedicalcare.com/en/news/fresenius-medical-care-reaches-agreement-in-principle-to-resolve-the-granuflornaturalyter-product-l/
Private Litigation Case Title: In Re: Fresenius Granuflo/Naturalyte Dialysate Products Liability Litigation
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/760412/fresenius-strikes-250m-deal-to-settle-dialysis-drug-mdl
